alert.note: Alert for Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 9:44PM CDT until September 22 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following counties, Banner and Morrill. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridgeport, Bayard, South Bayard Junction, Chimney Rock State Park and Bridgeport State Recreation Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
